result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Bowman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
1-year DPA. Conditions: 
- engage in no criminal conduct
- pay $1441.41 restitution (joint/several) 
- complete 40 hours CSW 
- no direct/indirect contact with Tanya Barforth or Charles Harp 
- pay $25/month case monitoring fee to DA office 
- file written report of compliance monthly with DA office
- provide proof of compliance to DA office
- noncompliance results in conviction/sentencing
- agreement can be terminated by either party in writing
- compliance results in dismissal with prejudice 
- conviction/sentencing resumes if State learns of misrepresentations or pre-existing factors
- bail/bond remains in effect

supervisions.notes: Defendant eligible for early discharge upon compliance with terms and conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Joint/Several restitution paid in full by co-defendant. 
Surcharge assessed on full amount. 
Cash bond applied.
Paid in full with cash bond and payments received from defendant.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
